summary: The Mausoleum at Halicarnassus was an impressive tomb built for Mausolus, a Persian ruler, and his wife Artemisia. It stood around 148 feet tall and was designed by Greek architects. The tomb featured beautiful sculptures created by famous artists. It was considered one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World due to its stunning design. Over time, earthquakes destroyed the mausoleum, but its name lives on, now used for any above-ground tomb.
title: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus
